title: What would be the benefits when we could discover how to create a lightsaber? Since that kind of technology would be so advanced that we could make 'light' just travel on a certain distance. - Quora

response.answer_text: Lightsaber technology would revolutionize several technologies. Limited range. Unlimited (OK, near-unlimited) cutting power. Compact, adjustable, and requires only minimal power. Caveat: not a full-on SWU fanboy here; it’s possible lightsabers require some element of Force-manipulation, that is, they must be operated by a living, sentient, being. I’m going to ignore that. “Paging Mr. Musk, Mr. Elon Musk to the white courtesy telephone, please.” “Musk here.” “Hi, Mr. Musk, we made your light-cutting things, they work exactly as you specified. We’re ready to go ahead with full production.” “Excellent, you’re fired. Tell your replacement to redesign my Tunnel Boring Machines and refit the steel cutting heads with light-cutting thingies. Your check is in the mail.” A tunnel boring machine (TBM to you) using lightsaber technology would be limited only by how quickly dross can be removed from the tunnel face. Drilling tunnels could literally be done at nearly freeway speed (and even in Los Angeles, freeway speed is fast enough for a TBM.Dentistry. No more drills. (Think about that.)Art and sculptureIndustrial-scale metal cutting—no more snapped CNC blades! Yes, water-cutters and plasma torches are pretty damn fast—but both need a lot of support system (blade lubricant, waste handling, water supply), and both use a simply obscene amount of energyDemolition.The list goes on and on.
